CC   -!- FUNCTION: Catalyzes the reduction of saturated fatty acyl-CoA with
CC       chain length C16 or C18 to fatty alcohols.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15220348, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15220349}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Hexadecanal + CoA + NADP(+) = hexadecanoyl-CoA
CC       + NADPH.
CC   -!- BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:
CC       pH dependence:
CC         Optimum pH is 7.4. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15220348};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts (via C-terminus) with PEX19, the interaction is
CC       required for targeting to peroxisomes.
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q8WVX9}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Peroxisome membrane {ECO:0000305}; Single-
CC       pass membrane protein {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:

CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;

CC         IsoId=Q922J9-4; Sequence=VSP_021681;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Widely expressed. Expressed in all tissues
CC       examined. Highest expression seen in preputial gland. Expressed in
CC       the brain where large quantities of ether lipids are synthesized.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15220348}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the fatty acyl-CoA reductase family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

ID   H3C_MOUSE               Reviewed;         136 AA.
AC   P02301;
DT   21-JUL-1986, integrated into UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot.
DT   13-JUN-2012, sequence version 3.
DT   04-MAR-2015, entry version 100.
DE   RecName: Full=Histone H3.3C;
DE   AltName: Full=Embryonic;
GN   Name=H3f3c; Synonyms=Gm14384;
OS   Mus musculus (Mouse).
OC   Eukaryota; Metazoa; Chordata; Craniata; Vertebrata; Euteleostomi;
OC   Mammalia; Eutheria; Euarchontoglires; Glires; Rodentia; Sciurognathi;
OC   Muroidea; Muridae; Murinae; Mus; Mus.
OX   NCBI_TaxID=10090;
RN   [1]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [GENOMIC DNA].
RX   PubMed=6457299; DOI=10.1073/pnas.78.7.4078;
RA   Sittman D.B., Chiu I.-M., Pan C.-J., Cohn R.H., Kedes L.H.,
RA   Marzluff W.F. Jr.;
RT   "Isolation of two clusters of mouse histone genes.";
RL   Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U.S.A. 78:4078-4082(1981).
RN   [2]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [LARGE SCALE GENOMIC DNA].
RC   STRAIN=C57BL/6J;
RX   PubMed=19468303; DOI=10.1371/journal.pbio.1000112;
RA   Church D.M., Goodstadt L., Hillier L.W., Zody M.C., Goldstein S.,
RA   She X., Bult C.J., Agarwala R., Cherry J.L., DiCuccio M., Hlavina W.,
RA   Kapustin Y., Meric P., Maglott D., Birtle Z., Marques A.C., Graves T.,
RA   Zhou S., Teague B., Potamousis K., Churas C., Place M., Herschleb J.,
RA   Runnheim R., Forrest D., Amos-Landgraf J., Schwartz D.C., Cheng Z.,
RA   Lindblad-Toh K., Eichler E.E., Ponting C.P.;
RT   "Lineage-specific biology revealed by a finished genome assembly of
RT   the mouse.";
RL   PLoS Biol. 7:E1000112-E1000112(2009).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Core component of nucleosome. Nucleosomes wrap and
CC       compact DNA into chromatin, limiting DNA accessibility to the
CC       cellular machineries which require DNA as a template. Histones
CC       thereby play a central role in transcription regulation, DNA
CC       repair, DNA replication and chromosomal stability. DNA
CC       accessibility is regulated via a complex set of post-translational
CC       modifications of histones, also called histone code, and
CC       nucleosome remodeling.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: The nucleosome is a histone octamer containing two
CC       molecules each of H2A, H2B, H3 and H4 assembled in one H3-H4
CC       heterotetramer and two H2A-H2B heterodimers. The octamer wraps
CC       approximately 147 bp of DNA.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus. Chromosome.
CC   -!- PTM: Acetylation is generally linked to gene activation.
CC       Acetylation on Lys-10 (H3K9ac) impairs methylation at Arg-9
CC       (H3R8me2s). Acetylation on Lys-19 (H3K18ac) and Lys-24 (H3K24ac)
CC       favors methylation at Arg-18 (H3R17me). Acetylation at Lys-123
CC       (H3K122ac) by EP300/p300 plays a central role in chromatin
CC       structure: localizes at the surface of the histone octamer and
CC       stimulates transcription, possibly by promoting nucleosome
CC       instability (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Citrullination at Arg-9 (H3R8ci) and/or Arg-18 (H3R17ci) by
CC       PADI4 impairs methylation and represses transcription.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Asymmetric dimethylation at Arg-18 (H3R17me2a) by CARM1 is
CC       linked to gene activation. Symmetric dimethylation at Arg-9
CC       (H3R8me2s) by PRMT5 is linked to gene repression (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Methylation at Lys-5 (H3K4me), Lys-37 and Lys-80 are linked
CC       to gene activation. Methylation at Lys-5 (H3K4me) facilitates
CC       subsequent acetylation of H3 and H4. Methylation at Lys-80 is
CC       associated with DNA double-strand break (DSB) responses and is a
CC       specific target for TP53BP1. Methylation at Lys-10 (H3K9me) and
CC       Lys-28 (H3K27me) are linked to gene repression. Methylation at
CC       Lys-10 (H3K9me) is a specific target for HP1 proteins (CBX1, CBX3
CC       and CBX5) and prevents subsequent phosphorylation at Ser-11
CC       (H3S10ph) and acetylation of H3 and H4. Methylation at Lys-5
CC       (H3K4me) and Lys-80 require preliminary monoubiquitination of H2B
CC       at 'Lys-120'. Methylation at Lys-10 (H3K9me) and Lys-28 (H3K27me)
CC       are enriched in inactive X chromosome chromatin. Monomethylation
CC       at Lys-57 (H3K56me1) by EHMT2/G9A in G1 phase promotes interaction
CC       with PCNA and is required for DNA replication (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated at Thr-4 (H3T3ph) by GSG2/haspin during
CC       prophase and dephosphorylated during anaphase. Phosphorylation at
CC       Ser-11 (H3S10ph) by AURKB is crucial for chromosome condensation
CC       and cell-cycle progression during mitosis and meiosis. In addition
CC       phosphorylation at Ser-11 (H3S10ph) by RPS6KA4 and RPS6KA5 is
CC       important during interphase because it enables the transcription
CC       of genes following external stimulation, like mitogens, stress,
CC       growth factors or UV irradiation and result in the activation of
CC       genes, such as c-fos and c-jun. Phosphorylation at Ser-11
CC       (H3S10ph), which is linked to gene activation, prevents
CC       methylation at Lys-10 (H3K9me) but facilitates acetylation of H3
CC       and H4. Phosphorylation at Ser-11 (H3S10ph) by AURKB mediates the
CC       dissociation of HP1 proteins (CBX1, CBX3 and CBX5) from
CC       heterochromatin. Phosphorylation at Ser-11 (H3S10ph) is also an
CC       essential regulatory mechanism for neoplastic cell transformation.
CC       Phosphorylated at Ser-29 (H3S28ph) by MLTK isoform 1, RPS6KA5 or
CC       AURKB during mitosis or upon ultraviolet B irradiation.
CC       Phosphorylation at Thr-7 (H3T6ph) by PRKCB is a specific tag for
CC       epigenetic transcriptional activation that prevents demethylation
CC       of Lys-5 (H3K4me) by LSD1/KDM1A. At centromeres, specifically
CC       phosphorylated at Thr-12 (H3T11ph) from prophase to early
CC       anaphase, by DAPK3 and PKN1. Phosphorylation at Thr-12 (H3T11ph)
CC       by PKN1 is a specific tag for epigenetic transcriptional
CC       activation that promotes demethylation of Lys-10 (H3K9me) by
CC       KDM4C/JMJD2C. Phosphorylation at Tyr-42 (H3Y41ph) by JAK2 promotes
CC       exclusion of CBX5 (HP1 alpha) from chromatin (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Lysine deamination at Lys-5 (H3K4all) to form allysine is
CC       mediated by LOXL2. Allysine formation by LOXL2 only takes place on
CC       H3K4me3 and results in gene repression (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the histone H3 family. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

RP   ISOPRENYLATION AT CYS-586.
RX   PubMed=10888661; DOI=10.1091/mbc.11.7.2191;
RA   Stickney J.T., Buss J.E.;

RN   [5]
RP   FUNCTION.
RX   PubMed=21551061; DOI=10.1126/science.1201711;
RA   Kim B.H., Shenoy A.R., Kumar P., Das R., Tiwari S., MacMicking J.D.;
RT   "A family of IFN-gamma-inducible 65-kD GTPases protects against
RT   bacterial infection.";
RL   Science 332:717-721(2011).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Hydrolyzes GTP to GMP in two consecutive cleavage
CC       reactions. Exhibits antiviral activity against influenza virus (By
CC       similarity). Promote oxidative killing and deliver antimicrobial
CC       peptides to autophagolysosomes, providing broad host protection
CC       against different pathogen classes. {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:21551061}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimerizes upon GTP-binding, dimerization is required
CC       for the second hydrolysis step from GDP to GMP. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250}. Golgi apparatus
CC       membrane {ECO:0000250}; Lipid-anchor {ECO:0000250}; Cytoplasmic
CC       side {ECO:0000250}. Secreted {ECO:0000250}. Note=Secreted from
CC       endothelial cells in the cerebrospinal fluid, upon bacterial
CC       challenge and independently of interferon-gamma induction. Golgi
CC       membrane localization requires isoprenylation and the presence of
CC       another IFN-gamma-induced factor (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: By interferon gamma during macrophage activation.
CC   -!- PTM: Prenylation of mouse GBP1 is incomplete. It persistently
CC       exists in the cell as a mixture of C20-modified and (more
CC       predominantly) unmodified form. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10888661}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the TRAFAC class dynamin-like GTPase
CC       superfamily. GB1/RHD3-type GTPase family. GB1 subfamily.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 GB1/RHD3-type G (guanine nucleotide-
CC       binding) domain. {ECO:0000305}.

RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (2.0 ANGSTROMS) OF 1-108 IN COMPLEX WITH RNF2
RP   AND ZINC IONS, FUNCTION, INTERACTION WITH RING1, MONOUBIQUITINATION,
RP   POLYUBIQUITINATION IN THE PRESENCE OF UBE2D3 AND RING2, AND SUBUNIT.
RX   PubMed=16710298; DOI=10.1038/sj.emboj.7601144;
RA   Buchwald G., van der Stoop P., Weichenrieder O., Perrakis A.,
RA   van Lohuizen M., Sixma T.K.;
RT   "Structure and E3-ligase activity of the Ring-Ring complex of polycomb
RT   proteins Bmi1 and Ring1b.";
RL   EMBO J. 25:2465-2474(2006).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Component of a Polycomb group (PcG) multiprotein PRC1-
CC       like complex, a complex class required to maintain the
CC       transcriptionally repressive state of many genes, including Hox
CC       genes, throughout development. PcG PRC1 complex acts via chromatin
CC       remodeling and modification of histones; it mediates
CC       monoubiquitination of histone H2A 'Lys-119', rendering chromatin
CC       heritably changed in its expressibility. In the PRC1 complex, it
CC       is required to stimulate the E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase activity
CC       of RNF2/RING2 (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of a PRC1-like complex. Interacts with RING1
CC       and RING2. Interacts vwith CBX7 and CBX8. Interacts with SPOP.
CC       Part of a complex consisting of BMI1, CUL3 and SPOP. Interacts
CC       with E4F1 (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Q9QXV1:Cbx8; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-927401, EBI-1216641;
CC       Q8IXK0:PHC2 (xeno); NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-927401, EBI-713786;
CC       Q9QWH1:Phc2; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-927401, EBI-642357;
CC       O35730:Ring1; NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-927401, EBI-929310;
CC       Q9CQJ4:Rnf2; NbExp=11; IntAct=EBI-927401, EBI-927321;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus. Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Detected in most organs with high expression
CC       levels in thymus, heart, brain and testis.
CC   -!- PTM: May be polyubiquitinated; which does not lead to proteasomal
CC       degradation (By similarity). Monoubiquitinated. {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16710298}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 RING-type zinc finger.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00175}.

RN   [7]
RP   SUBCELLULAR LOCATION.
RX   PubMed=23039116; DOI=10.1111/gtc.12005;
RA   Kogo H., Tsutsumi M., Inagaki H., Ohye T., Kiyonari H., Kurahashi H.;
RT   "HORMAD2 is essential for synapsis surveillance during meiotic
RT   prophase via the recruitment of ATR activity.";
RL   Genes Cells 17:897-912(2012).
RN   [8]
RP   ACETYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT LYS-1496, AND IDENTIFICATION BY
RP   MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   TISSUE=Embryonic fibroblast;
RX   PubMed=23806337; DOI=10.1016/j.molcel.2013.06.001;
RA   Park J., Chen Y., Tishkoff D.X., Peng C., Tan M., Dai L., Xie Z.,
RA   Zhang Y., Zwaans B.M., Skinner M.E., Lombard D.B., Zhao Y.;
RT   "SIRT5-mediated lysine desuccinylation impacts diverse metabolic
RT   pathways.";
RL   Mol. Cell 50:919-930(2013).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Required for checkpoint mediated cell cycle arrest in
CC       response to DNA damage within both the S phase and G2/M phases of
CC       the cell cycle. May serve as a scaffold for the recruitment of DNA
CC       repair and signal transduction proteins to discrete foci of DNA
CC       damage marked by 'Ser-139' phosphorylation of histone H2AFX. Also
CC       required for downstream events subsequent to the recruitment of
CC       these proteins. These include phosphorylation and activation of
CC       the ATM, CHEK1 and CHEK2 kinases, and stabilization of TP53 and
CC       apoptosis. ATM and CHEK2 may also be activated independently by a
CC       parallel pathway mediated by TP53BP1 (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer. Interacts with several proteins involved in
CC       the DNA damage response, although not all these interactions may
CC       be direct. Interacts with CHEK2, which requires ATM-mediated
CC       phosphorylation within the FHA domain of CHEK2. Interacts
CC       constitutively with the BRCA1-BARD1 complex, SMC1A and TP53BP1.
CC       Interacts with ATM and FANCD2, and these interactions are reduced
CC       upon DNA damage. Also interacts with the PRKDC complex, composed
CC       of XRCC6/KU70, XRCC5/KU80 and PRKDC/XRCC7. This interaction may be
CC       required for PRKDC autophosphorylation, which is essential for DNA
CC       double strand break (DSB) repair. When phosphorylated by ATM,
CC       interacts with RNF8 (via FHA domain). Interacts with CEP164. When
CC       phosphorylated, interacts with APTX (via FHA-like domain) (By
CC       similarity). Interacts with H2AFX, which requires phosphorylation
CC       of H2AFX. Interacts with the MRN complex, composed of
CC       MRE11A/MRE11, RAD50, and NBN. {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15611643}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus. Chromosome. Note=Associated with
CC       chromatin. Relocalizes to discrete nuclear foci following DNA
CC       damage, this requires phosphorylation of H2AFX. Colocalizes with
CC       APTX at sites of DNA double-strand breaks (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: Tandemly repeated BRCT domains are characteristic of
CC       proteins involved in DNA damage signaling. In MDC1, these repeats
CC       are required for localization to chromatin which flanks sites of
CC       DNA damage marked by 'Ser-139' phosphorylation of H2AFX (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated upon exposure to ionizing radiation (IR),
CC       ultraviolet radiation (UV), and hydroxyurea (HU). Phosphorylation
CC       in response to IR requires ATM, NBN, and possibly CHEK2. Also
CC       phosphorylated during the G2/M phase of the cell cycle and during
CC       activation of the mitotic spindle checkpoint. Phosphorylation at
CC       Thr-4 by ATM stabilizes and enhances homodimerization via the FHA
CC       domain (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Sumoylation at Lys-1461 by PIAS4 following DNA damage
CC       promotes ubiquitin-mediated degradation. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Ubiquitinated by RNF4, leading to proteasomal degradation;
CC       undergoes 'Lys-48'-linked polyubiquitination. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 2 BRCT domains. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00033}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 FHA domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00086}.

CC   Copyrighted by the UniProt Consortium, see http://www.uniprot.org/terms
CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

RP   FUNCTION, INTERACTION WITH BOP1, AND SUBCELLULAR LOCATION.

RN   [7]
RP   INTERACTION WITH IRS1 AND UBTF, AND SUBCELLULAR LOCATION.
RX   PubMed=15169904; DOI=10.1128/MCB.24.12.5421-5433.2004;
RA   Prisco M., Maiorana A., Guerzoni C., Calin G., Calabretta B., Voit R.,
RA   Grummt I., Baserga R.;
RT   "Role of pescadillo and upstream binding factor in the proliferation
RT   and differentiation of murine myeloid cells.";
RL   Mol. Cell. Biol. 24:5421-5433(2004).
RN   [8]
RP   FUNCTION, INTERACTION WITH MAP1B, AND SUBCELLULAR LOCATION.
RX   PubMed=17308336; DOI=10.1074/jbc.M610977200;
RA   Lerch-Gaggl A.F., Sun K., Duncan S.A.;
RT   "Light chain 1 of microtubule-associated protein 1B can negatively
RT   regulate the action of Pes1.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 282:11308-11316(2007).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Component of the PeBoW complex, which is required for
CC       maturation of 28S and 5.8S ribosomal RNAs and formation of the 60S
CC       ribosome. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03028,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15225545, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17308336}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of the PeBoW complex, composed of BOP1, PES1
CC       and WDR12. Within the PeBoW complex BOP1 interacts directly with
CC       PES1 and WDR12. The PeBoW complex also associates with the 66S
CC       pre-ribosome. Interacts with IRS1 and UBTF. May interact with
CC       MAP1B. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03028,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15169904, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15225545,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17308336}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus, nucleolus. Nucleus, nucleoplasm.
CC       Chromosome. Note=Appears to localize to the periphery of metaphase
CC       chromosomes during mitosis and to the prenucleolar bodies that
CC       form in mitotic cells prior to the actual nucleoli.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Ubiquitous. Highest levels appear to be found
CC       in tissues that contain a population of proliferating cells, such
CC       as ovary and testis. Also appears to be highly expressed in kidney
CC       and liver. In the brain expression is restricted to neural
CC       progenitor cells and postmitotic neurons. Highly expressed in
CC       malignant astrocytes. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11112348,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:12237316}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: In 2-cell and 4-cell stage interphase
CC       blastomeres expression is restricted to a sub-nuclear band that
CC       encircles one or more large vacuoles within the nucleus. These
CC       vacuoles may give rise to the mature nucleolus. Later in
CC       embryogenesis high levels are detected in developing liver. Is
CC       also widely and highly expressed throughout the developing brain
CC       and spinal cord at embryonic day 13. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11071894,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:12237316}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Induced in malignant astrocytes following the loss of
CC       p53. Induced in hepatocytes following partial hepatectomy.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11071894, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12237316}.
CC   -!- PTM: Sumoylated. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03028}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Embryos die during preimplantation stages of
CC       development, with blastomeres failing to progress past morula
CC       stages. Within blastocysts the nucleoli fail to form correctly and
CC       the number of ribosomes appears dramatically reduced.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12237316}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the pescadillo family. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-
CC       Rule:MF_03028}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 BRCT domain. {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-
CC       Rule:MF_03028}.

RP   METHIONINE [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   TISSUE=Embryonic fibroblast;
RX   PubMed=19131326; DOI=10.1074/mcp.M800451-MCP200;
RA   Sweet S.M., Bailey C.M., Cunningham D.L., Heath J.K., Cooper H.J.;
RT   "Large scale localization of protein phosphorylation by use of
RT   electron capture dissociation mass spectrometry.";
RL   Mol. Cell. Proteomics 8:904-912(2009).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Binds to F-actin and exhibits pH-sensitive F-actin
CC       depolymerizing activity. Regulates actin cytoskeleton dynamics.
CC       Important for normal progress through mitosis and normal
CC       cytokinesis. Plays a role in the regulation of cell morphology and
CC       cytoskeletal organization. Required for the up-regulation of
CC       atypical chemokine receptor ACKR2 from endosomal compartment to
CC       cell membrane, increasing its efficiency in chemokine uptake and
CC       degradation (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Can bind G- and F-actin in a 1:1 ratio of cofilin to
CC       actin. It is a major component of intranuclear and cytoplasmic
CC       actin rods.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus matrix. Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton.
CC       Cell projection, ruffle membrane {ECO:0000250}; Peripheral
CC       membrane protein {ECO:0000250}; Cytoplasmic side {ECO:0000250}.
CC       Cell projection, lamellipodium membrane {ECO:0000250}; Peripheral
CC       membrane protein {ECO:0000250}; Cytoplasmic side {ECO:0000250}.
CC       Note=Colocalizes with the actin cytoskeleton in membrane ruffles
CC       and lamellipodia. Detected at the cleavage furrow and contractile
CC       ring during cytokinesis. Almost completely in nucleus in cells
CC       exposed to heat shock (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Widely distributed in various tissues.
CC   -!- PTM: Inactivated by phosphorylation on Ser-3. Phosphorylated on
CC       Ser-3 in resting cells (By similarity). Dephosphorylated by
CC       PDXP/chronophin; this restores its activity in promoting actin
CC       filament depolymerization. The phosphorylation of Ser-24 may
CC       prevent recognition of the nuclear localization signal (By
CC       similarity). Phosphorylated via a ARRB1-RAC1-LIMK1-PAK1 cascade
CC       upon active ligand stimulation of atypical chemokine receptor
CC       ACKR2 (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the actin-binding proteins ADF family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 ADF-H domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00599}.

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Catalyzes the ATP-dependent carboxylation of acetyl-CoA
CC       to malonyl-CoA (By similarity). Carries out three functions:
CC       biotin carboxyl carrier protein, biotin carboxylase and
CC       carboxyltransferase (By similarity). Involved in inhibition of
CC       fatty acid and glucose oxidation and enhancement of fat storage
CC       (PubMed:11283375, PubMed:12920182, PubMed:15677334,
CC       PubMed:18487439, PubMed:22362781). May play a role in regulation
CC       of mitochondrial fatty acid oxidation through malonyl-CoA-
CC       dependent inhibition of carnitine palmitoyltransferase 1
CC       (PubMed:10677481). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:O00763,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:11283375, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12920182,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15677334, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18487439,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:22362781, ECO:0000303|PubMed:10677481}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + acetyl-CoA + HCO(3)(-) = ADP + phosphate
CC       + malonyl-CoA. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:O00763}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + biotin-[carboxyl-carrier-protein] +
CC       HCO(3)(-) = ADP + phosphate + carboxy-biotin-[carboxyl-carrier-
CC       protein]. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:O00763}.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=biotin; Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:57586;
CC         Evidence={ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:O00763};
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=Mn(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:29035;
CC         Evidence={ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00409};
CC       Note=Binds 2 manganese ions per subunit. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00409};
CC   -!- ENZYME REGULATION: Activity is increased by oligomerization.
CC       Activated by citrate. Citrate and MID1IP1 promote oligomerization.
CC       Inhibited by malonyl-CoA. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:O00763}.
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Lipid metabolism; malonyl-CoA biosynthesis; malonyl-CoA
CC       from acetyl-CoA: step 1/1.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Monomer, homodimer, and homotetramer. Can form
CC       filamentous polymers. Interacts with MID1IP1; interaction with
CC       MID1IP1 promotes oligomerization and increases its activity.
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:O00763}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Mitochondrion {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10677481}.
CC       Nucleus {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:O00763}. Endomembrane system
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:O00763}. Note=May associate with membranes.
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:O00763}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated by AMPK, leading to inactivation of the
CC       enzyme. Required for the maintenance of skeletal muscle lipid and
CC       glucose homeostasis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24913514}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Normal morphology, fertility, growth rate
CC       and lifespan but higher than normal food consumption and fatty
CC       acid oxidation rate and decreased fat content in adipose tissue
CC       and liver (PubMed:11283375). A high-fat/high-carbohydrate diet
CC       results in maintenance of normal insulin and glucose levels with
CC       less weight gain and less fat accumulation than wild-type mice
CC       (PubMed:12920182). Elevated levels of Ucp2 in adipose tissue and
CC       heart but not in skeletal muscle or liver, and elevated levels of
CC       Ucp3 in skeletal muscle but not in heart or brown adipose tissue
CC       (PubMed:12920182). Significant decrease in body weight, weight of
CC       epidydimal fat pads and levels of hepatic triglycerides under a
CC       range of dietary conditions including normal chow diet, fasting
CC       and refeeding a fat-free high-carbohydrate diet, and a high-
CC       fat/high-carbohydrate diet (PubMed:22362781). Up-regulation of
CC       lipogenic enzymes under de novo lipogenic conditions but reduced
CC       fat accumulation in liver (PubMed:22362781). Primary cultured
CC       adipocytes show increased fatty acid and glucose oxidation rates
CC       and increased lipolysis (PubMed:15677334). Reduced heart size,
CC       reduced Mlycd and malonyl-CoA levels in mutant hearts, reduced
CC       myocardial triglyceride levels, higher myocardial oleate and
CC       glucose oxidation rates, reduced levels of Ppara and reduced
CC       activation of Mtor (PubMed:18487439, PubMed:22730442). However, it
CC       has also been reported that mutants show no differences in body
CC       weight, food intake, body composition or glucose homeostasis as
CC       compared with controls fed on chow or a high-fat diet
CC       (PubMed:20368432). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11283375,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:12920182, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15677334,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18487439, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20368432,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:22362781, ECO:0000269|PubMed:22730442}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 ATP-grasp domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00409}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 biotin carboxylation domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|SAAS:SAAS011764_004_002026}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 biotinyl-binding domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU01066}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 carboxyltransferase domain. {ECO:0000255}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Motor protein that may participate in process critical
CC       to neuronal development and function such as cell migration,
CC       neurite outgrowth and vesicular transport.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=P46735-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=P46735-2; Sequence=VSP_003347;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Prominent expression is seen in the brain,
CC       lung and liver. It is also expressed in the heart and testis. A
CC       high level expression is seen in virtually all neurons (but not
CC       glia) in the postnatal and adult mouse brain and in neuroblasts of
CC       the cerebellar external granular layer.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the TRAFAC class myosin-kinesin ATPase
CC       superfamily. Myosin family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 5 IQ domains. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00116}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 myosin motor domain. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 myosin tail domain. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- CAUTION: Represents an unconventional myosin. This protein should
CC       not be confused with the conventional myosin-1 (MYH1).
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: ATPase involved in DNA replication, may facilitate
CC       loading of CDC45 onto pre-replication complexes. May hydrolyze D-
CC       tyrosyl-tRNA(Tyr) into D-tyrosine and free tRNA(Tyr), a possible
CC       defense mechanism against a harmful effect of D-tyrosine (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer. Interacts with CDC45 and TOPBP1 (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000250}. Cytoplasm
CC       {ECO:0000305}. Note=Associated with chromatin at some replication
CC       origins containing functional DNA-unwinding elements.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q9DD18-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q9DD18-2; Sequence=VSP_026130;
CC   -!- PTM: Preferentially phosphorylated in cells arrested early in S
CC       phase. Phosphorylation in the C-terminus weakens the interaction
CC       with CDC45 (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the DTD family. {ECO:0000305}.

RP   FUNCTION, AND IDENTIFICATION IN A COMPLEX WITH RARG AND SRA1.
RX   PubMed=15327771; DOI=10.1016/j.molcel.2004.06.044;
RA   Zhao X., Patton J.R., Davis S.L., Florence B., Ames S.J.,
RA   Spanjaard R.A.;
RT   "Regulation of nuclear receptor activity by a pseudouridine synthase
RT   through posttranscriptional modification of steroid receptor RNA
RT   activator.";
RL   Mol. Cell 15:549-558(2004).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Converts specific uridines to PSI in a number of tRNA
CC       substrates. Acts on positions 27/28 in the anticodon stem and also
CC       positions 34 and 36 in the anticodon of an intron containing tRNA.
CC       Involved in regulation of nuclear receptor activity possibly
CC       through pseudouridylation of SRA1 RNA. Isoforms 3 and 4 do not
CC       form pseudouridine when expressed in vitro.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10094309, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11085940,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15327771}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: tRNA uridine(38-40) = tRNA pseudouridine(38-
CC       40). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10094309}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Forms a complex with RARG and the SRA1 RNA in the
CC       nucleus. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15327771}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Isoform 1: Mitochondrion {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Isoform 2: Nucleus {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=4;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q9WU56-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q9WU56-2; Sequence=VSP_020114;
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=Q9WU56-3; Sequence=VSP_020114, VSP_021792;
CC       Name=4;
CC         IsoId=Q9WU56-4; Sequence=VSP_020114, VSP_021791;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the tRNA pseudouridine synthase TruA
CC       family. {ECO:0000305}.

RN   [3]
RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [LARGE SCALE MRNA].
RC   STRAIN=C3H/He; TISSUE=Mammary tumor, and Mesenchymal cell;
RX   PubMed=15489334; DOI=10.1101/gr.2596504;
RG   The MGC Project Team;
RT   "The status, quality, and expansion of the NIH full-length cDNA
RT   project: the Mammalian Gene Collection (MGC).";
RL   Genome Res. 14:2121-2127(2004).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Component of the PRP19-CDC5L complex that forms an
CC       integral part of the spliceosome and is required for activating
CC       pre-mRNA splicing. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of the PRP19-CDC5L splicing complex composed of
CC       a core complex comprising a homotetramer of PRPF19, CDC5L, PLRG1
CC       and BCAS2, and at least three less stably associated proteins
CC       CTNNBL1, CWC15 and HSPA8. Interacts (via its WD40 repeat domain)
CC       directly with CDC5L (via its C-terminal); the interaction is
CC       required for mRNA splicing but not for spliceosome assembly. Also
CC       interacts directly in the complex with BCAS2 and PRPF19 (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000250}. Nucleus speckle
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the WD repeat PRL1/PRL2 family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 7 WD repeats. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00221}.

RP   ACETYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT LYS-97, AND IDENTIFICATION BY
RP   MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   TISSUE=Embryonic fibroblast;
RX   PubMed=23806337; DOI=10.1016/j.molcel.2013.06.001;
RA   Park J., Chen Y., Tishkoff D.X., Peng C., Tan M., Dai L., Xie Z.,
RA   Zhang Y., Zwaans B.M., Skinner M.E., Lombard D.B., Zhao Y.;
RT   "SIRT5-mediated lysine desuccinylation impacts diverse metabolic
RT   pathways.";
RL   Mol. Cell 50:919-930(2013).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Positively regulates the transcription of MTUS1 and
CC       negatively regulates the transcription of MTUS2/TIP150. With
CC       EEF1A1 and TXK, forms a complex that acts as a T-helper 1 (Th1)
CC       cell-specific transcription factor and binds the promoter of IFN-
CC       gamma to directly regulate its transcription, and is thus involved
CC       importantly in Th1 cytokine production (By similarity). Involved
CC       in the base excision repair (BER) pathway, by catalyzing the
CC       poly(ADP-ribosyl)ation of a limited number of acceptor proteins
CC       involved in chromatin architecture and in DNA metabolism. This
CC       modification follows DNA damages and appears as an obligatory step
CC       in a detection/signaling pathway leading to the reparation of DNA
CC       strand breaks. Mediates the poly(ADP-ribosyl)ation of APLF and
CC       CHFR. Required for PARP9 and DTX3L recruitment to DNA damage
CC       sites. PARP1-dependent PARP9-DTX3L-mediated ubiquitination
CC       promotes the rapid and specific recruitment of 53BP1/TP53BP1,
CC       UIMC1/RAP80, and BRCA1 to DNA damage sites (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: NAD(+) + (ADP-D-ribosyl)(n)-acceptor =
CC       nicotinamide + (ADP-D-ribosyl)(n+1)-acceptor.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00397}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of a base excision repair (BER) complex,
CC       containing at least XRCC1, PARP2, POLB and LRIG3. Homo- and
CC       heterodimer with PARP2. Interacts with PARP3, APTX and SRY
CC       Interacts (when poly-ADP-ribosylated) with CHD1L. Interacts with
CC       the DNA polymerase alpha catalytic subunit POLA1; this interaction
CC       functions as part of the control of replication fork progression
CC       (By similarity). The SWAP complex consists of NPM1, NCL, PARP1 and
CC       SWAP70. Interacts with TIAM2 and ZNF423. Interacts with RNF4.
CC       Interacts with EEF1A1 and TXK (By similarity). Interacts with
CC       RNF146 (By similarity). Interacts with SNAI1 (via zinc fingers);
CC       the interaction requires SNAI1 to be poly-ADP-ribosylated and non-
CC       phosphorylated (active) by GSK3B. Interacts (when poly-ADP-
CC       ribosylated) with PARP9 (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P03087:- (xeno); NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-642213, EBI-1555770;
CC       Q9WTL8:Arntl; NbExp=7; IntAct=EBI-642213, EBI-644534;
CC       P70677:Casp3; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-642213, EBI-1790419;
CC       P97864:Casp7; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-642213, EBI-5307197;
CC       P20263:Pou5f1; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-642213, EBI-1606219;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus. Nucleus, nucleolus {ECO:0000250}.
CC       Note=Localizes at sites of DNA damage. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative initiation; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1; Synonyms=Long;
CC         IsoId=P11103-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2; Synonyms=Short, sPARP-1;
CC         IsoId=P11103-2; Sequence=VSP_018970;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Widely expressed. Expression is correlated
CC       with proliferation, with higher levels occurring during early
CC       fetal development and organogenesis and in the highly
CC       proliferative cell compartments of adult. Expressed in B-cells
CC       that have been induced to switch to various Ig isotypes.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9642267}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: At stage E12.5, expressed at high level in
CC       the developing liver and kidneys. Expressed at higher level in the
CC       genital ridge and the spinal ganglia. At E18.5, preferentially
CC       expressed in the thymus and in regions of the nervous system.
CC       Within the developing trunk, preferential expression persisted in
CC       the liver and became restricted to the cortical region of the
CC       kidney, spleen, adrenal gland, and to stomach and intestinal
CC       epithelia. From E14.5 to E18.5, as well as in the adult, expressed
CC       at the highest level in thymus. Expression is particularly high in
CC       the subcapsular zone of the thymus where immature lymphocytes
CC       proliferate. Expressed at high level in the seminiferous tubules
CC       of the developing testis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11948190}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated by PRKDC and TXK.
CC   -!- PTM: Poly-ADP-ribosylated by PARP2. Poly-ADP-ribosylation mediates
CC       the recruitment of CHD1L to DNA damage sites (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: S-nitrosylated, leading to inhibit transcription regulation
CC       activity. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16464859}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Mice show a complete lack of nuclear
CC       poly(ADP-ribosyl)ation. Mice are however viable and fertile.
CC       Moreover, repair of UV and MNNG induced DNA damage are not
CC       affected. However, about 30% of the mutant mice developed
CC       pathological skin aberrations on a mixed 129/Sv x C57B1/6 genetic
CC       background. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:7578427}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: The ADP-D-ribosyl group of NAD(+) is transferred to
CC       an acceptor carboxyl group on a histone or the enzyme itself, and
CC       further ADP-ribosyl groups are transferred to the 2'-position of
CC       the terminal adenosine moiety, building up a polymer with an
CC       average chain length of 20-30 units.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 BRCT domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00033}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 PARP alpha-helical domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00398}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 PARP catalytic domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00397}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 2 PARP-type zinc fingers.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00264}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=AAF61293.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Cleaves sequentially the 2 innermost alpha-1,3-linked
CC       glucose residues from the Glc(2)Man(9)GlcNAc(2) oligosaccharide
CC       precursor of immature glycoproteins.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Hydrolysis of terminal (1->3)-alpha-D-
CC       glucosidic links in (1->3)-alpha-D-glucans.
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Glycan metabolism; N-glycan metabolism.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Heterodimer of a catalytic alpha subunit (GANAB) and a
CC       beta subunit (PRKCSH). Binds glycosylated PTPRC.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Endoplasmic reticulum {ECO:0000250}. Golgi
CC       apparatus {ECO:0000250}. Melanosome {ECO:0000250}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Filament-forming cytoskeletal GTPase (By similarity).
CC       May play a role in cytokinesis (Potential). May play a role in
CC       platelet secretion (By similarity). {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Septins polymerize into heterooligomeric protein
CC       complexes that form filaments, and can associate with cellular
CC       membranes, actin filaments and microtubules. GTPase activity is
CC       required for filament formation (By similarity). Interacts with
CC       CDK14, SEPT4, SEPT5 and SEPT7 (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250}. Cytoplasm,
CC       cytoskeleton {ECO:0000250}.

RC   TISSUE=Lung;

RN   [5]
RP   FUNCTION.
RC   STRAIN=129/J;
RX   PubMed=7885444; DOI=10.1038/374258a0;
RA   Noakes P.G., Gautam M., Mudd J., Sanes J.R., Merlie J.P.;
RT   "Aberrant differentiation of neuromuscular junctions in mice lacking
RT   s-laminin/laminin beta 2.";
RL   Nature 374:258-262(1995).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Binding to cells via a high affinity receptor, laminin
CC       is thought to mediate the attachment, migration and organization
CC       of cells into tissues during embryonic development by interacting
CC       with other extracellular matrix components.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:7885444}.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Laminin-3 (S-laminin) regulates the formation of motor
CC       nerve terminals. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:7885444}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Laminin is a complex glycoprotein, consisting of three
CC       different polypeptide chains (alpha, beta, gamma), which are bound
CC       to each other by disulfide bonds into a cross-shaped molecule
CC       comprising one long and three short arms with globules at each
CC       end. Beta-2 is a subunit of laminin-3 (laminin-121 or S-laminin),
CC       laminin-4 (laminin-221 or S-merosin), laminin-7 (laminin-321 or
CC       KS-laminin), laminin-9 (laminin-421), laminin-11 (laminin-521),
CC       laminin-14 (laminin-423) and laminin-15 (laminin-523).
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted, extracellular space, extracellular
CC       matrix, basement membrane.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Neuromuscular synapse and kidney glomerulus.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The alpha-helical domains I and II are thought to interact
CC       with other laminin chains to form a coiled coil structure.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: Domains VI and IV are globular.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 13 laminin EGF-like domains.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00460}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 laminin IV type B domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00462}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 laminin N-terminal domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00466}.

CC   Distributed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivs License
CC   -----------------------------------------------------------------------

CC   -!- FUNCTION: May play a role in the integrity of hemidesmosome and
CC       the attachment of basal keratinocytes to the underlying basement
CC       membrane. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: The 120 kDa linear IgA disease antigen homolog is an
CC       anchoring filament component involved in dermal-epidermal
CC       cohesion. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homotrimers of alpha 1(XVII)chains. Interacts (via
CC       cytoplasmic region) with ITGB4 (via cytoplasmic region). Interacts
CC       (via cytoplasmic region) with DST (via N-terminus). Interacts (via
CC       N-terminus) with PLEC. Interacts (via cytoplasmic region) with DSP
CC       (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P08246:ELANE (xeno); NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-6251005, EBI-986345;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell junction, hemidesmosome. Membrane;
CC       Single-pass type II membrane protein. Note=Localized along the
CC       plasma membrane of the hemidesmosome. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: 120 kDa linear IgA disease antigen homolog:
CC       Secreted, extracellular space, extracellular matrix, basement
CC       membrane {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q07563-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q07563-2; Sequence=VSP_009362;
CC   -!- PTM: The intracellular/endo domain is disulfide-linked.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Prolines at the third position of the tripeptide repeating
CC       unit (G-X-Y) are hydroxylated in some or all of the chains.
CC   -!- PTM: The ectodomain is shedded from the surface of keratinocytes
CC       resulting in a 120-kDa soluble form, also named as 120 kDa linear
CC       IgA disease antigen homolog. The shedding is mediated by membrane-
CC       bound metalloproteases. This cleavage is inhibited by
CC       phosophorylation at Ser-551 (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.

RP   PHOSPHORYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT TYR-101, AND IDENTIFICATION
RP   BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   TISSUE=Brain;
RX   PubMed=18034455; DOI=10.1021/pr0701254;
RA   Ballif B.A., Carey G.R., Sunyaev S.R., Gygi S.P.;

RN   [7]
RP   GLYCOSYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT ASN-158; ASN-163 AND ASN-266.
RX   PubMed=19349973; DOI=10.1038/nbt.1532;
RA   Wollscheid B., Bausch-Fluck D., Henderson C., O'Brien R., Bibel M.,
RA   Schiess R., Aebersold R., Watts J.D.;
RT   "Mass-spectrometric identification and relative quantification of N-
RT   linked cell surface glycoproteins.";
RL   Nat. Biotechnol. 27:378-386(2009).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: This is the non-catalytic component of the active
CC       enzyme, which catalyzes the hydrolysis of ATP coupled with the
CC       exchange of Na(+) and K(+) ions across the plasma membrane. The
CC       beta subunit regulates, through assembly of alpha/beta
CC       heterodimers, the number of sodium pumps transported to the plasma
CC       membrane.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Involved in cell adhesion and establishing epithelial
CC       cell polarity. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Composed of three subunits: alpha (catalytic), beta and
CC       gamma. Interacts with NKAIN1, NKAIN2 and NKAIN4. Interacts with
CC       MLC1 (By similarity). Part of a complex containing MLC1, TRPV4,
CC       AQP4 and HEPACAM (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane; Single-pass type II membrane
CC       protein.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The C-terminal lobe folds into an immunoglobulin-like
CC       domain and mediates cell adhesion properties. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the X(+)/potassium ATPases subunit beta
CC       family. {ECO:0000305}.

RP   ACETYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT LYS-179 AND LYS-244, AND
RP   IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   TISSUE=Embryonic fibroblast;
RX   PubMed=23806337; DOI=10.1016/j.molcel.2013.06.001;
RA   Park J., Chen Y., Tishkoff D.X., Peng C., Tan M., Dai L., Xie Z.,
RA   Zhang Y., Zwaans B.M., Skinner M.E., Lombard D.B., Zhao Y.;
RT   "SIRT5-mediated lysine desuccinylation impacts diverse metabolic
RT   pathways.";
RL   Mol. Cell 50:919-930(2013).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Isoform 1: Ubiquitin-protein ligase which is a core
CC       component of several complexes mainly involved in pre-mRNA
CC       splicing and DNA repair. Core component of the PRP19C/Prp19
CC       complex/NTC/Nineteen complex which is part of the spliceosome and
CC       participates in its assembly, its remodeling and is required for
CC       its activity. During assembly of the spliceosome, mediates 'Lys-
CC       63'-linked polyubiquitination of the U4 spliceosomal protein
CC       PRPF3. Ubiquitination of PRPF3 allows its recognition by the U5
CC       component PRPF8 and stabilizes the U4/U5/U6 tri-snRNP spliceosomal
CC       complex. Recruited to RNA polymerase II C-terminal domain (CTD)
CC       and the pre-mRNA, it may also couple the transcriptional and
CC       spliceosomal machineries. The XAB2 complex, which contains PRPF19,
CC       is also involved in pre-mRNA splicing, transcription and
CC       transcription-coupled repair. Beside its role in pre-mRNA splicing
CC       PRPF19, as part of the PRP19-CDC5L complex, plays a role in the
CC       DNA damage response/DDR. It is recruited to the sites of DNA
CC       damage by the RPA complex where PRPF19 directly ubiquitinates RPA1
CC       and RPA2. 'Lys-63'-linked polyubiquitination of the RPA complex
CC       allows the recruitment of the ATR-ATRIP complex and the activation
CC       of ATR, a master regulator of the DNA damage response. May also
CC       play a role in DNA double-strand break (DSB) repair by recruiting
CC       the repair factor SETMAR to altered DNA. As part of the PSO4
CC       complex may also be involved in the DNA interstrand cross-
CC       links/ICLs repair process. In addition, may also mediate 'Lys-48'-
CC       linked polyubiquitination of substrates and play a role in
CC       proteasomal degradation (PubMed:17349974). May play a role in the
CC       biogenesis of lipid droplets (PubMed:17118936). May play a role in
CC       neural differentiation possibly through its function as part of
CC       the spliceosome (By similarity). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9JMJ4,
CC       ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9UMS4, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17118936,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17349974}.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Isoform 2: Forced expression leads to suppression of
CC       neuronal differentiation, and on the contrary to stimulation of
CC       astroglial cell differentiation in retinoic acid-primed P19 cells
CC       (PubMed:16352598). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16352598}.
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Protein modification; protein ubiquitination.
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9UMS4}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homotetramer. Component of the Prp19
CC       complex/PRP19C/Nineteen complex/NTC and related complexes
CC       described as PRP19-CDC5L splicing complex and PSO4 complex. A
CC       homotetramer of PRPF19, CDC5L, PLRG1 and BCAS2 constitute the core
CC       of those complexes. The interaction with CDC5L, PLRG1 and BCAS2 is
CC       direct within this core complex. At least three less stably
CC       associated proteins CTNNBL1, CWC15 and HSPA8 are found in the
CC       Prp19 complex. The Prp19 complex associates with the spliceosome
CC       during its assembly and remodeling recruiting additional proteins.
CC       Component of the XAB2 complex, a multimeric protein complex
CC       composed of XAB2, PRPF19, AQR, ZNF830, ISY1, and PPIE. Interacts
CC       with CWC22 and EIF4A3 in an RNA-independent manner. Interacts with
CC       RPA1 and RPA2; the PRP19-CDC5L complex is recruited to the sites
CC       of DNA repair where it interacts with the replication protein A
CC       complex (RPA). Interacts with SETMAR; required for SETMAR
CC       recruitment to site of DNA damage. Interacts with U2AF2; the
CC       interaction is direct and recruits the Prp19 complex to RNA
CC       polymerase II C-terminal domain (CTD) and the pre-mRNA. Interacts
CC       with PRPF3. Interacts with APEX1, DNTT and PSMB4. Interacts with
CC       KNSTRN (By similarity). Interacts with PSMC5 (PubMed:17349974).
CC       Isoform 2 (via N-terminus) interacts with PPIA. Isoform 2 does not
CC       interact with CDC5L (PubMed:16352598).
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9UMS4, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16352598,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17349974}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Isoform 1: Nucleus
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16352598}. Nucleus, nucleoplasm
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9UMS4}. Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton, spindle
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9UMS4}. Cytoplasm
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9UMS4}. Lipid droplet
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17118936}. Note=Nucleoplasmic in interphase
CC       cells. Irregularly distributed in anaphase cells. In prophase
CC       cells, uniformly distributed, but not associated with condensing
CC       chromosomes. Found in extrachromosomal regions in metaphase cells.
CC       Mainly localized to the mitotic spindle apparatus when chromosomes
CC       segregate during anaphase. When nuclei reform during late
CC       telophase, uniformly distributed in daughter cells and displays no
CC       preferred association with decondensing chromatin. Recruited on
CC       damaged DNA at sites of double-strand break (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9UMS4}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Isoform 2: Cytoplasm
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16352598}. Nucleus
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16352598}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=3;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q99KP6-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q99KP6-2; Sequence=VSP_011945;
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=Q99KP6-3; Sequence=VSP_012192;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in white and brown adipose tissues,
CC       brain and to a lower extent in liver, kidney, muscle, lung and
CC       spleen (at protein level). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17118936}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Up-regulated in differentiating adipocytes
CC       (PubMed:17118936). Isoform 2 maximal expression level during the
CC       neural differentiation of P19 cells treated with retinoic acid
CC       (RA) is estimated to be 2.5-fold of the expression level of the
CC       untreated cells and it is detected 1-2 days after RA treatment and
CC       it decreases steeply thereafter to the basal level. Isoform 2
CC       expression level increases steeply after 1 day of RA treatment and
CC       is estimated to be 4.2-fold of the original level at 0 hours
CC       (PubMed:16352598). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16352598,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17118936}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The 7 WD repeats are necessary and sufficient to support
CC       interaction with the RPA complex. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9UMS4}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the WD repeat PRP19 family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 U-box domain. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 7 WD repeats. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00221}.

RP   DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE.

RP   DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE.
RX   PubMed=23675506; DOI=10.1371/journal.pone.0063815;
RA   Wong P., Leo V.I., Low M., Mak T.W., Zhang X., Reilly P.T.;
RT   "Targeted ANP32E mutant mice do not demonstrate obvious movement
RT   defects.";
RL   PLoS ONE 8:E63815-E63815(2013).
RN   [11]
RP   DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE, AND FUNCTION.
RX   PubMed=24463511; DOI=10.1038/nature12922;
RA   Obri A., Ouararhni K., Papin C., Diebold M.L., Padmanabhan K.,
RA   Marek M., Stoll I., Roy L., Reilly P.T., Mak T.W., Dimitrov S.,
RA   Romier C., Hamiche A.;
RT   "ANP32E is a histone chaperone that removes H2A.Z from chromatin.";
RL   Nature 505:648-653(2014).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Histone chaperone that specifically mediates the genome-
CC       wide removal of histone H2A.Z/H2AFZ from the nucleosome: removes
CC       H2A.Z/H2AFZ from its normal sites of deposition, especially from
CC       enhancer and insulator regions. Not involved in deposition of
CC       H2A.Z/H2AFZ in the nucleosome. May stabilize the evicted
CC       H2A.Z/H2AFZ-H2B dimer, thus shifting the equilibrium towards
CC       dissociation and the off-chromatin state (PubMed:24463511).
CC       Inhibits activity of protein phosphatase 2A (PP2A). Does not
CC       inhibit protein phosphatase 1. May play a role in cerebellar
CC       development and synaptogenesis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11430900,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:14964690, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16420440,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:24463511}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of a SWR1-like complex, composed of EP400,
CC       KAT5/TIP60, TRRAP, BRD8, RUVBL1, RUVBL2, ING3 and ANP32E; the
CC       complex does not contain SRCAP. Interacts with H2A.Z/H2AFZ (By
CC       similarity). Interacts with the importin alpha KPNA1 and KPNA2.
CC       {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10692581}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm. Nucleus.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=P97822-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=P97822-2; Sequence=VSP_007373;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed at highest levels in cerebellum and
CC       spleen. In the cerebellum, expressed mainly in granule cells and,
CC       to a lesser extent, in Purkinje cells.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11430900}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Low levels are found at postnatal day 4.
CC       Levels increase from postnatal day 7 to postnatal day 17. Levels
CC       decrease and remain low in the adult.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11430900}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The H2A.Z-interacting domain (ZID) mediates a direct
CC       interaction with H2A.Z/H2AFZ. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated. The phosphorylation is nuclear localization
CC       signal (NLS)-dependent (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: No visible phenotype. Mice are viable and
CC       fertile (PubMed:20844742, PubMed:21049064, PubMed:23675506). They
CC       display a subtle neurological clasping phenotype and mild motor
CC       deficits (PubMed:20844742). Motor defects were not confirmed by a
CC       subsequent analysis (PubMed:23675506). Deletion in embryonic
CC       fibroblasts results in the appearance of a significant number of
CC       new H2A.Z/H2AFZ around the transcription start site as well as at
CC       other chromatin regions (PubMed:24463511).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20844742, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21049064,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:23675506, ECO:0000269|PubMed:24463511}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the ANP32 family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 4 LRR (leucine-rich) repeats. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 LRRCT domain. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Catalyzes phosphatidylethanolamine biosynthesis from
CC       CDP-ethanolamine. It thereby plays a central role in the formation
CC       and maintenance of vesicular membranes. Involved in the formation
CC       of phosphatidylethanolamine via 'Kennedy' pathway (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: CDP-ethanolamine + 1,2-diacyl-sn-glycerol =
CC       CMP + a phosphatidylethanolamine.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=Mg(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:18420; Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC       Name=Mn(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:29035; Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Phospholipid metabolism; phosphatidylethanolamine
CC       biosynthesis; phosphatidylethanolamine from ethanolamine: step
CC       3/3.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Membrane {ECO:0000305}; Multi-pass membrane
CC       protein {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the CDP-alcohol phosphatidyltransferase
CC       class-I family. {ECO:0000305}.

RP   INTERACTION WITH RET, AND TISSUE SPECIFICITY.

RN   [13]
RP   PHOSPHORYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT SER-458, AND IDENTIFICATION
RP   BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RX   PubMed=19144319; DOI=10.1016/j.immuni.2008.11.006;
RA   Trost M., English L., Lemieux S., Courcelles M., Desjardins M.,
RA   Thibault P.;
RT   "The phagosomal proteome in interferon-gamma-activated macrophages.";
RL   Immunity 30:143-154(2009).
RN   [14]
RP   STRUCTURE BY NMR OF 270-329.
RX   PubMed=17922258; DOI=10.1007/s10858-007-9201-7;
RA   Ortega Roldan J.L., Romero Romero M.L., Ora A., Ab E.,
RA   Lopez Mayorga O., Azuaga A.I., van Nuland N.A.;
RT   "The high resolution NMR structure of the third SH3 domain of CD2AP.";
RL   J. Biomol. NMR 39:331-336(2007).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Seems to act as an adapter protein between membrane
CC       proteins and the actin cytoskeleton. In collaboration with CBLC,
CC       modulates the rate of RET turnover and may act as regulatory
CC       checkpoint that limits the potency of GDNF on neuronal survival.
CC       Controls CBLC function, converting it from an inhibitor to a
CC       promoter of RET degradation. May play a role in receptor
CC       clustering and cytoskeletal polarity in the junction between T-
CC       cell and antigen-presenting cell. May anchor the podocyte slit
CC       diaphragm to the actin cytoskeleton in renal glomerolus. Also
CC       required for cytokinesis. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10514378}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Self-associates. Homodimer (Potential). Interacts with F-
CC       actin, PKD2, NPHS1 and NPHS2. Interacts with WTIP. Interacts with
CC       DDN; interaction is direct. Interacts (via SH3 2 domain) with CBL
CC       (via phosphorylated C-terminus). Interacts with BCAR1/p130Cas (via
CC       SH3 domain). Interacts with MVB12A and ARHGAP17. Interacts with
CC       ANLN, CD2 and CBLB. Interacts with PDCD6IP and TSG101. Interacts
CC       with RIN3. Interacts directly with RET (inactive) and CBLC; upon
CC       RET activation by GDNF suggested to dissociate from RET as
CC       CBLC:CD2AP complex. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10514378,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:10913159, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11733379,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:11733557, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12217865,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:14736876, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17537921,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18753381, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9741631,
CC       ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton. Cell projection,
CC       ruffle. Note=During late anaphase and telophase, concentrates in
CC       the vicinity of the midzone microtubules and in the midbody in
CC       late telophase (By similarity). Located at podocyte slit diaphragm
CC       between podocyte foot processes. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in podocytes (at protein level).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18753381}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: Potential homodimerization is mediated by the coiled coil
CC       domain. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated on tyrosine residues; probably by c-Abl, Fyn
CC       and c-Src. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Death at 6 to 7 weeks of age from renal
CC       failure. Mice show defects in epithelial foot processes,
CC       accompanied by mesangial cell hyperplasia and extracellular matrix
CC       deposition. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10514378}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 3 SH3 domains. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00192}.

RC   TISSUE=Brain, Mammary tumor, and Neural stem cell;
RX   PubMed=15489334; DOI=10.1101/gr.2596504;

RP   PHOSPHORYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT SER-159, AND IDENTIFICATION
RP   BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   TISSUE=Liver;
RX   PubMed=17242355; DOI=10.1073/pnas.0609836104;
RA   Villen J., Beausoleil S.A., Gerber S.A., Gygi S.P.;
RT   "Large-scale phosphorylation analysis of mouse liver.";
RL   Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U.S.A. 104:1488-1493(2007).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Regulatory subunit of serine/threonine-protein
CC       phosphatase 4 (PP4). May regulate the activity of PPP4C at
CC       centrosomal microtubule organizing centers. Its interaction with
CC       the SMN complex leads to enhance the temporal localization of
CC       snRNPs, suggesting a role of PPP4C in maturation of spliceosomal
CC       snRNPs. The PPP4C-PPP4R2-PPP4R3A PP4 complex specifically
CC       dephosphorylates H2AFX phosphorylated on 'Ser-140' (gamma-H2AFX)
CC       generated during DNA replication and required for DNA double
CC       strand break repair (By similarity). Mediates RPA2
CC       dephosphorylation by recruiting PPP4C to RPA2 in a DNA damage-
CC       dependent manner. RPA2 dephosphorylation is required for the
CC       efficient RPA2-mediated recruitment of RAD51 to chromatin
CC       following double strand breaks, an essential step for DNA repair
CC       (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Serine/threonine-protein phosphatase 4 (PP4) occurs in
CC       different assemblies of the catalytic and one or more regulatory
CC       subunits. Component of the PP4 complexes PPP4C-PPP4R2, PPP4C-
CC       PPP4R2-PPP4R3A and PPP4C-PPP4R2-PPP4R3B. The PPP4C-PPP4R2 complex
CC       appears to be a tetramer composed of 2 molecules of PPP4C and 2
CC       molecules of PPP4R2. Interacts with DDX20/GEMIN3 and GEMIN4 (By
CC       similarity). Interacts with RPA2; this DNA damage-dependent
CC       interaction recruits PPP4C leading to RPA2 dephosphorylation (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton, microtubule
CC       organizing center, centrosome {ECO:0000250}. Nucleus
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Note=Ionizing radiation induces relocalization to
CC       nuclear foci and colocalization with RPA2. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the PPP4R2 family. {ECO:0000305}.

RC   TISSUE=Embryonic fibroblast;
RX   PubMed=23806337; DOI=10.1016/j.molcel.2013.06.001;
RA   Park J., Chen Y., Tishkoff D.X., Peng C., Tan M., Dai L., Xie Z.,
RA   Zhang Y., Zwaans B.M., Skinner M.E., Lombard D.B., Zhao Y.;
RT   "SIRT5-mediated lysine desuccinylation impacts diverse metabolic
RT   pathways.";
RL   Mol. Cell 50:919-930(2013).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Multitasking protein, involved in apoptosis,
CC       transcription, nucleosome assembly and histone chaperoning.
CC       Isoform 2 anti-apoptotic activity is mediated by inhibition of the
CC       GZMA-activated DNase, NME1. In the course of cytotoxic T-
CC       lymphocyte (CTL)-induced apoptosis, GZMA cleaves SET, disrupting
CC       its binding to NME1 and releasing NME1 inhibition. Isoform 1 and
CC       isoform 2 are potent inhibitors of protein phosphatase 2A. Isoform
CC       1 and isoform 2 inhibit EP300/CREBBP and PCAF-mediated acetylation
CC       of histones (HAT) and nucleosomes, most probably by masking the
CC       accessibility of lysines of histones to the acetylases. The
CC       predominant target for inhibition is histone H4. HAT inhibition
CC       leads to silencing of HAT-dependent transcription and prevents
CC       active demethylation of DNA. Both isoforms stimulate DNA
CC       replication of the adenovirus genome complexed with viral core
CC       proteins; however, isoform 2 specific activity is higher (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Headphone-shaped homodimer. Isoform 1 and isoform 2
CC       interact directly with each other and with ANP32A within the
CC       tripartite INHAT (inhibitor of acetyltransferases) complex.
CC       Isoform 1 and isoform 2 interact also with histones. Isoform 2 is
CC       a omponent of the SET complex, composed of at least ANP32A, APEX1,
CC       HMGB2, NME1, SET and TREX1, but not NME2 or TREX2. Within this
CC       complex, directly interacts with ANP32A, NME1, HMGB2 and TREX1;
CC       the interaction with ANP32A is enhanced after cleavage. Interacts
CC       with APBB1, CHTOP, SETBP1, SGOL1. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22872859}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm, cytosol {ECO:0000250}.
CC       Endoplasmic reticulum {ECO:0000250}. Nucleus, nucleoplasm
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Note=In the cytoplasm, found both in the cytosol
CC       and associated with the endoplasmic reticulum. The SET complex is
CC       associated with the endoplasmic reticulum. Following CTL attack
CC       and cleavage by GZMA, moves rapidly to the nucleus, where it is
CC       found in the nucleoplasm, avoiding the nucleolus. Similar
CC       translocation to the nucleus is also observed for lymphocyte-
CC       activated killer cells after the addition of calcium (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=3;
CC       Name=1; Synonyms=TAF-I alpha;
CC         IsoId=Q9EQU5-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2; Synonyms=TAF-I beta;
CC         IsoId=Q9EQU5-2; Sequence=VSP_009869;
CC         Note=Contains a N6-acetyllysine at position 11. Contains a
CC         phosphoserine at position 15. Contains a phosphothreonine at
CC         position 23. {ECO:0000250};
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=Q9EQU5-3; Sequence=VSP_009870, VSP_009871;
CC   -!- DOMAIN: A long alpha helix in the N-terminus mediates
CC       dimerization, while the earmuff domain is responsible for core
CC       histone and dsDNA binding. The C-terminal acidic domain mediates
CC       the inhibition of histone acetyltransferases and is required for
CC       the DNA replication stimulatory activity (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Some glutamate residues are glycylated by TTLL8. This
CC       modification occurs exclusively on glutamate residues and results
CC       in a glycine chain on the gamma-carboxyl group.
CC   -!- PTM: N-terminus of isoform 1 is methylated by METTL11A/NTM1.
CC       Mainly trimethylated. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20668449}.
CC   -!- PTM: Isoform 2 is cleaved after Lys-176 by GZMA. The cleavage
CC       inhibits its nucelosome assembly activity and disrupts the
CC       inhibition on NME1 (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the nucleosome assembly protein (NAP)
CC       family. {ECO:0000305}.

RP   ACETYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT LYS-154, AND IDENTIFICATION BY
RP   MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   TISSUE=Embryonic fibroblast;
RX   PubMed=23806337; DOI=10.1016/j.molcel.2013.06.001;
RA   Park J., Chen Y., Tishkoff D.X., Peng C., Tan M., Dai L., Xie Z.,
RA   Zhang Y., Zwaans B.M., Skinner M.E., Lombard D.B., Zhao Y.;
RT   "SIRT5-mediated lysine desuccinylation impacts diverse metabolic
RT   pathways.";
RL   Mol. Cell 50:919-930(2013).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Signaling adapter that couples activated growth factor
CC       receptors to signaling pathways. Participates in signaling
CC       downstream of the angiopoietin receptor TEK/TIE2, and plays a role
CC       in the regulation of endothelial cell migration and sprouting
CC       angiogenesis (By similarity). Participates in a signaling cascade
CC       initiated by activated KIT and KITLG/SCF. Isoform p47Shc and
CC       isoform p52Shc, once phosphorylated, couple activated receptor
CC       kinases to Ras via the recruitment of the GRB2/SOS complex and are
CC       implicated in the cytoplasmic propagation of mitogenic signals.
CC       Isoform p47Shc and isoform p52 may thus function as initiators of
CC       the Ras signaling cascade in various non-neuronal systems. Isoform
CC       p66Shc does not mediate Ras activation, but is involved in signal
CC       transduction pathways that regulate the cellular response to
CC       oxidative stress and life span. Isoform p66Shc acts as a
CC       downstream target of the tumor suppressor p53 and is indispensable
CC       for the ability of stress-activated p53 to induce elevation of
CC       intracellular oxidants, cytochrome c release and apoptosis. The
CC       expression of isoform p66Shc has been correlated with life span.
CC       {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12571362,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17272725}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with the NPXY motif of tyrosine-phosphorylated
CC       IGF1R and INSR in vitro via the PID domain. Once activated, binds
CC       to GRB2. Interacts with tyrosine-phosphorylated DDR2 and CD3T.
CC       Interacts with the N-terminal region of APS. Interacts with GRB7
CC       and KIT (By similarity). Interacts with PTK2/FAK1 (By similarity).
CC       Interacts with phosphorylated LRP1 and IRS4. Interacts with FLT4
CC       (tyrosine-phosphorylated) (By similarity). Interacts with PDGFRB
CC       (tyrosine-phosphorylated). Interacts with ERBB4 (By similarity).
CC       Interacts with TEK/TIE2 (tyrosine-phosphorylated) (By similarity).
CC       Interacts with ALK, GAB2, TRIM31, INPP5D/SHIP1 and INPPL1/SHIP2.
CC       Interacts with PTPN6/SHP (tyrosine phosphorylated). Identified in
CC       a complex containing FGFR4, NCAM1, CDH2, PLCG1, FRS2, SRC, SHC1,
CC       GAP43 and CTTN. Interacts with EPHB1 and GRB2; activates the
CC       MAPK/ERK cascade to regulate cell migration. Interacts with the
CC       Trk receptors NTRK1, NTRK2 and NTRK3; in a phosphotyrosine-
CC       dependent manner. {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10068665,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:10080542, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10395202,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:11433297, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12367511,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:12925710, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19665990,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:8643691, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8654924,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:9083021, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9099679,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:9885561}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P0DMN7:Amd1; NbExp=7; IntAct=EBI-300201, EBI-644529;
CC       Q60631:Grb2; NbExp=7; IntAct=EBI-300201, EBI-1688;
CC       Q9JKF1:Iqgap1; NbExp=5; IntAct=EBI-300201, EBI-644633;
CC       P35831:Ptpn12; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-300201, EBI-2642957;
CC       Q9Z179:Shcbp1; NbExp=5; IntAct=EBI-300201, EBI-644352;
CC       Q64729:Tgfbr1; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-1019301, EBI-2899393;
CC       Q62312:Tgfbr2; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-1019301, EBI-2899332;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Isoform p47Shc: Mitochondrion matrix
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Note=Targeting of isoform p47Shc to mitochondria is
CC       mediated by its first 32 amino acids, which behave as a bona fide
CC       mitochondrial targeting sequence. Isoform p52Shc and isoform
CC       p66Shc, that contain the same sequence but more internally
CC       located, display a different subcellular localization (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Isoform p66Shc: Mitochondrion
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17272725}. Note=In case of oxidative
CC       conditions, phosphorylation at 'Ser-36' of isoform p66Shc, leads
CC       to mitochondrial accumulation.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing, Alternative initiation; Named isoforms=3;
CC         Comment=In human, it is alternative promoter usage that produces
CC         such isoforms.;
CC       Name=p66Shc; Synonyms=p66;
CC         IsoId=P98083-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=p52Shc; Synonyms=p52;
CC         IsoId=P98083-2; Sequence=VSP_018791;
CC         Note=Produced by alternative splicing.;
CC       Name=p47Shc; Synonyms=p47;
CC         IsoId=P98083-3; Sequence=VSP_018792;
CC         Note=Produced by alternative initiation at Met-46 of isoform
CC         p52.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Widely expressed. Expressed in neural stem
CC       cells but absent in mature neurons.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: In response to a variety of growth factors, isoform p47Shc
CC       and isoform p52 bind to phosphorylated receptors through their
CC       phosphotyrosine binding (PID) and/or SH2 domains. The PID and SH2
CC       domains bind to specific phosphorylated tyrosine residues in the
CC       Asn-Pro-Xaa-Tyr(P) motif. Isoform p47Shc and isoform p52Shc are in
CC       turn phosphorylated on three tyrosine residues within the extended
CC       proline-rich domain. These phosphotyrosines act as docking site
CC       for GRB2 and thereby are involved in Ras activation.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated in response to FLT4 signaling (By similarity).
CC       Tyrosine phosphorylated by ligand-activated PDGFRB (By
CC       similarity). May be tyrosine phosphorylated by activated PTK2/FAK1
CC       (By similarity). Tyrosine phosphorylated by TEK/TIE2 (By
CC       similarity). Tyrosine phosphorylated by activated PTK2B/PYK2 (By
CC       similarity). Dephosphorylation by PTPN2 may regulate interaction
CC       with GRB2 (By similarity). Phosphorylated by activated epidermal
CC       growth factor receptor. Phosphorylated in response to KIT
CC       signaling. Isoform p47Shc and isoform p52Shc are phosphorylated on
CC       tyrosine residues of the Pro-rich domain. Isoform p66Shc is
CC       phosphorylated on Ser-36 by PRKCB upon treatment with insulin,
CC       hydrogen peroxide or irradiation with ultraviolet light. FLT3
CC       signaling promotes tyrosine phosphorylation of isoform p47Shc and
CC       isoform p52Shc. Also tyrosine phosphorylated by ligand-activated
CC       ALK. {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10080542,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:9165038}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 PID domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00148}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 SH2 domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00191}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Catalyzes the exchange of an acyl for a long-chain alkyl
CC       group and the formation of the ether bond in the biosynthesis of
CC       ether phospholipids. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: 1-acyl-glycerone 3-phosphate + a long-chain
CC       alcohol = an alkyl-glycerone 3-phosphate + a long-chain acid
CC       anion.
